newsitem.title: USA: Dominion Energy buys Michigan natgas producer.
newsitem.headline: Dominion Energy buys Michigan natgas producer.

text.p: Dominion Energy Inc said it has acquired Wolverine Gas & Oil, a production company headquartered in Grand Rapids, Mich., with daily natural gas volume in excess of 10 million cubic feet and proven reserves of some 75 billion cubic feet equivalent.
Terms of the purchase announced were not disclosed, the Dominion Resources Inc subsidiary said. Before its purchase, Wolverine acted as an operator of Dominion Energy properties in Michigan.
"This acquisition is expected to add immediately to earnings," Dominion Energy said.

"In addition to realizing its (undisclosed) projected contribution to earnings, we will realize other advantages with this purchase. By acquiring Wolverine's experienced staff, we are enhancing our technical expertise as operators in a very important state for Dominion Energy's production business. This should allow us to improve drilling economics and identify and exploit other efficiencies inherent in any consolidation of business operations of this nature."
